sentences.english: She heard a rustle in the bushes.
sentences.chinese: 她听到灌木丛中一阵窸窣声。

sentences.english: A rustling was heard, and then more coughing.
sentences.chinese: 那屋子里面，正在窸窸窣窣的响，接着便是一通咳嗽。

sentences.english: A rustling was heard, and then more coughing.
sentences.chinese: 那屋子里面，正在窸窸窣窣的响，接着便是一通咳嗽。
她穿着绸衣窸窣地向前走去。

sentences.english: Some animal was scuffling in the bushes.
sentences.chinese: 有只动物在灌木丛中窸窸窣窣地穿行。

sentences.english: Some animal was scuffling in the bushes.
sentences.chinese: 有只动物在灌木丛中窸窸窣窣地穿行。
树叶在微风中窸窣作响。

sentences.english: He listened to the rustle of her skirts.
sentences.chinese: 他倾听她裙子的窸窣声。

sentences.english: He could hear whispering and scuffling on the other side of the door.
sentences.chinese: 他能听见门那边的低语声和窸窸窣窣的走动声。

sentences.english: He could hear whispering and scuffling on the other side of the door.
sentences.chinese: 他能听见门那边的低语声和窸窸窣窣的走动声。

sentences.english: At night, the cockroaches filled the house with their rustlings.
sentences.chinese: 夜里，屋里尽是蟑螂窸窸瑟瑟的声音。

sentences.english: At night, the cockroaches filled the house with their rustlings.
sentences.chinese: 夜里，屋里尽是蟑螂窸窸瑟瑟的声音。

definition: very slight sound/rustling (onom.)/to stream down (of tears)/luxuriant growth (of vegetation)
looking up expectantly/speaking softly (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [yu2 yu2])
child's buttocks (esp. Cantonese)/(onom.) crack, slap, clap, clatter etc
(onom.) scraping sound/ripping of fabric/screeching of tires
